intro: Echinopogon gunnianus, commonly known as the Gunns' needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Echinopogon gunnianus is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
